result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan Michael Kuhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: WITH Huber privileges.    IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
Defendant to report to probation within 24 hours.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No contact with victim or residence. Take all prescription medications as prescribed. 
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 08/18/2017 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED
Application for Jail Time Credit form

3:04 pm  Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn in court with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court has reviewed BIF submitted by State as well as sentencing memorandum filed by Attorney Harvey.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by DA Wiedenfeld.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Harvey.
Defendant makes statement.
Court imposes the following sentence:

Six (6) months Jail with Huber, imposed and stayed.
Defendant placed on probation for two (2) years.  Defendant to report to probation within 24 hours.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Twenty (20) days in Jail with work release to commence on or before August 18, 2017 at 8 a.m.
Defendant may travel to IL for work purposes
Pay $100 fine and court costs including supervision fees
Counseling as recommended by Agent
No contact with victim or his residence
Not to possess any weapons or firearms
Provide DNA sample, unless previously provided, and pay surcharge
Take all prescription medications as prescribed 
Defendant will be entitled to one (1) day dead time, if revoked
Sentencing Proposal
Background Information Form (BIF)

9:58 am  Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn in court with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Donohoo notes defense believes there are two prior countable offenses pursuant to Sec. 906.09 but after review of Illinois records, ADA Donohoo believes there are seven additional countable offenses for a total of nine offenses.
There is no agreement by parties as to actual number of countable offenses.
Court hears from Attorney Harvey who believes Court should review records and make determination pursuant to Sec. 906.09.
10:05 am  Bruce Scoville duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Donohoo.
10:13 am  Exh 1 marked, identified, offered into evidence and received with no objection.
10:19 am  Exh 2 marked, identified, offered into evidence and received with no objection.
10:22 am  Record reflects accurate identification of defendant by witness.
10:27 am  Exh 3 identified and published.
10:31 am  Exh 3 moved into evidence and received with no objection.
10:37 am  Court questions witness.
10:37 am  Cross by Attorney Harvey.
11:11 am  No redirect.  State rests.
11:11 am  Attorney Harvey moves to dismiss based on failure of State to prove elements of offense.  Court denies motion.
11:12 am  Court will take fifteen minute break to review defendant's records.

11:36 am  Back on the record.  Same appearances.
Court found defendant's records to be confusing but will find there are three convictions from 1992 on.
Court finds there are other convictions that are remote in time and will not consider them.
11:39 am  Attorney Harvey advises Court that defendant does with to testify.  
11:39 am  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or remain silent.
11:42 am  Evan Michael Kuhn duly sworn and testified on direct exam of Attorney Harvey.
11:58 am  Court will break for lunch and resume at 1 p.m.

12:58 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.
12:58 pm  Evan Kuhn back on witness stand, reminded by Court that he is still under oath, and continues testifying on direct of Attorney Harvey.
1:02 pm  Cross exam by ADA Donohoo.
1:10 pm  Redirect by Attorney Harvey.
1:17 pm  Recross by ADA Donohoo.
1:18 pm  Follow-up by Attorney Harvey.
1:19 pm  Defense rests.
1:19 pm  Exh 4 marked and ADA Donohoo requests Court take judicial notice.
1:20 pm  Response by Attorney Harvey.  Court will not accept Exh 4.
1:20 pm  Record closed.
1:20 pm  Argument by ADA Donohoo.
1:25 pm  Argument by Attorney Harvey.
1:34 pm  Rebuttal by ADA Donohoo.
1:35 pm  Court finds testimony of defendant is not credible and that his actions and language were aggressive and consistent with elements of the crime.
Court finds beyond a reasonable doubt that the State has met their burden and will adjudge defendant guilty.
Court verifies that exhibits received are photocopies for retention purposes.
Exh 4 was withdrawn and records regarding prior offenses are also withdrawn.
Court directs that any sentencing memorandums be filed no later than June 16, 2017.
1:48 pm  Court in recess.
DA Service Fees Invoice #17-114           $80.00
of Trial by Jury
Court trial on April 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn in court with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wishes to waive right to jury trial and request that matter to be tried to Court.
Court has colloquy with defendant.  Attorney Harvey believes waiver is freely, knowingly and intelligently made.
Waiver form completed and submitted to Court.
Defense got open file from State.  Offer was made and rejected.
Jury trial canceled and matter set over for court trial.
Minutes filed.  Court trial scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
DA Service Fees Invoice #16-803            $80.00

Scheduling Order
Copies provided to Counsel in Court on this date
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn in court with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 10:13 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial. Parties confirm for trial. Court addresses motions in limine.  Motion #1 - Court addresses the State as to number of convictions. Response by Atty. Harvey believes there are two (2) priors. State objects to any reference to no prior convictions. Court agrees and bars that reference. Motion #2 - Barring statement of victim unless personal testimony is given. Court's response. Will address at time of trial. #3 - State believes that Defense has all discovery turned over. Response by Atty. Harvey. #4 - State has no other acts evidence motions for the Court. Response by Atty. Harvey. State will be sure to limit his officer's testimony as to prior knowledge of the defendant. #5 - Sequestration of witnesses - No objection by the State except for Court officer and vicitm. Court grants with Officer and victim being allowed. #6 - previously dealt with.  Court addresses photo of gun holster. Response by Atty. Harvey. Court resets trial and gives parties new scheduling order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's
DA Service Fees Invoice # 16-496    $80.00

Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn in court with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  Matthew Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains. Motion deadline 07-11-16. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Evan Michael Kuhn appeared with attorney Steven Harvey, Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.S.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Notice of Arrest
Defendant Evan Kuhn present in court, in custody via video with attorney Steven Harvey for bond purposes only. Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
